intro: Corydalis capnoides var. tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features slender, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
